$ui_gray_1Fast travel is currently $clr_reddisabled$ui_gray_1 in your gameplay settings, so you shouldn't have received a tutorial pop-up for it at all. Please report that as a bug. That said, if you enable it, you'll be able to right-click on your PDA map to quickly travel from location to location.

$ui_gray_1Now that you've discovered more than one location within the Zone, you can make use of this system to quickly travel between your current location and $clr_gldany travel point you've already visited$ui_gray_1. If you'd rather be able to freely travel anywhere, you can change that in Anomaly's settings.

$ui_gray_1You can use this system to quickly travel between your current location and $clr_gldany travel point on the map$ui_gray_1. Your current settings don't require you to visit a location first$ui_gray_1 in order to fast travel to it, but you can change that in Anomaly's settings if you'd prefer it to be more restrictive.

$ui_gray_1In your mod list, all types of fast travel are handled by the $clr_gldFair Fast Travel$ui_gray_1 addon--so named because all of its features (including all the ones mentioned hereafter) are configurable in MCM, and can be disabled or customized as you prefer.

Using Fast Travel

%s
 
%s
 
%s
 
%s

$ui_gray_1To use the fast travel system, $clr_gldright-click on any travel point$ui_gray_1 you see in your PDA map, and select one of the $clr_gldavailable travel options$ui_gray_1. Each option will show %s%sany relevant restrictions.
$ui_gray_1Available travel points have a $clr_gldspecial map icon$ui_gray_1, seen to the right. %s
If a powerful psy field or other hazard is preventing travel to a location, this will be indicated by a different icon.
the distance and duration of the trip, along with
the fare that must be paid, and
$ui_gray_1Once you click the travel option, your trip will automatically begin after a brief fade. %s
Your companions, if any, will travel with you--unless you've told them to wait.
Before you travel, take heed of the following:

%s
 
%s 
%s
 
%s
\n%s
$clr_gldPlan your trip carefully$ui_gray_1--you never know what's waiting at the other end. Traveling blindly to unsecured locations is asking to get ambushed.
$clr_gldFast travel fares are enabled$ui_gray_1. You must pay $clr_gld%s %s$ui_gray_1 per meter of distance to use this service. If you can't pay, you can't travel.
$clr_gldTime will pass during fast travel$ui_gray_1%s.
, and you may find yourself $clr_gldhungry or tired$ui_gray_1 at the end of a long trip
$clr_gldEquipment wear-and-tear is enabled$ui_gray_1--your equipped gear may suffer some minor condition loss to $clr_gldsimulate the effects of travel$ui_gray_1.
This will be indicated by a special red icon.

Until you progress the main story and $clr_glddeactivate the Brain Scorcher$ui_gray_1, a dangerous psy field will $clr_gldprevent fast travel$ui_gray_1 between certain parts of the north and south of the map. %s
